Moffat, who still lives of his "I revitalised Sherlock Holmes" fame delivers a poor follow-up with this badly acted, badly directed, go nowhere, uninspiring feast of pretentious rubbish.I love Stanley Tucci and David Tennant, but they can't make up for the poor script and lifeless story. Tucci, wasted as another Hannibal Lector-clone (seriously, how many times do writers feel they're good enough to replicate such a character?) phones in his role, and gives nothing interesting to his character. Nothing. A monotone drawl and "i'm so much smarter than you" attitude gets boring real quick.David Tennant is capable of better (see Broadchurch) and fumbles through the poor script, and at no time convinces me that he's a priest, a father, a selfless soul willing to anything for his family. Instead, he's just a dumb moron who is just like his director - unable to make good decisions.Then you've got Dolly Wells as Janice. Probably the worst character to hit the small screen since Urkel. Moffat tries to show his solidarity with women everywhere by giving us a ridiculous, loathsome victim, who you simply cannot identify with, nor feel any sympathy for. By the end of the first episode I was already praying for her demise. Sadly, it didn't come.And finally we have the "Rainman of Journalists", the "Queen of Derrrrrr", the "Dumbest Person in the Room" - Lydia West, as Beth. Pretty much the stupidest, most clueless, naive and dumbest so called "journalist" that has ever had the occupation of journalist in the history of television. For 3 and a half episodes, Beth's first response to every comment or piece of dialogue is "Huh?" or "Wait, I don't understand", or "But why?". Give a rubik's cube to a cow and she'll do a better job at understanding than Beth. I felt bad for the actress, who was only reading someone else's words (well, that's the job, right?), but poor Lydia was criminally miscast as the tenacious young journo hellbent on finding her friend. Actually, the whole last sentence was soooo wrong. Never tenacious, definitely too young to have any credibility, and Janice and Beth were never really friends.Horrible casting, poor plot/story, lazy direction, irritating and pretentious dialogue, characters who you would give a toss about. Moffat's fall from grace is complete.

reviews.review_title: Umm.. what the hell was this?
reviews.content: I thought David Tennant and Stanley Tucci together had to be a winner but then again this was Netflix! Not sure what crap i just watched but wow!I mean the creators were probably high on another plane in another space time reality when they created this cause this was one incredible waste of fabulous talent.The basic premise was stupid enough for the 90s but abominable for 2022. The fact that even David Tennant and Stanley Tucci can't save this show is a huge indicator of the gaping plot holes and lack of sense in this series. I'm not even sure how the agreed to this script tbh.Clean, cook, dance,meditate or do anything with your time than waste it on this (whatever it was)

reviews.review_title: "How does anyone ever get murdered? There's so much admin!"
reviews.content: This is a straight up quirky series. It's not meant to be taken seriously. It's only four episodes, each an hour long.The story is bonkers, but in a fantastic way. I have watched other shows with ridiculous plots that weren't as good, funny, and heartfelt at times. Honestly, the story is a scenario that I could see happening in real life, because real life is just that seriously messed up, and so are human beings. Also, when I saw Steven Moffat was involved, I was even more excited because I knew I was going to be entertained.I love David Tennant, which is why I started watching it in the first place. He definitely lived up to my expectations that I knew he would. I thought Stanley Tucci was a nice touch. He is a phenomenal actor and always a delight to see. I really enjoyed his character, it looked like he had fun playing this role. I thought that everyone's acting was solid. The cast selection was perfectly picked, no one felt out of place.I don't understand some of these low rating reviews. I guess those reviewers don't have the same twisted sense of humor I do to enjoy this type of crime-comedy genre. I was laughing out loud quite often. I personally thought this was brilliantly created and brought to life. I would absolutely welcome and watch a second season.

reviews.review_title: A delicious twisty spiderweb packaged into 4 episodes
reviews.content: "Inside Man" is some fun, creative work, but does require suspension of disbelief. If you allow yourself to lean into it, you would be in for a delightful whirlwind ride. It is also great that there are only four episodes. Sometimes less is more, and this show has nailed it in that sense. All of the characters are likable, from the apathetic son to the bureaucratic warden to the murderous prisoner sidekick, and these are only supporting characters. The main characters are even more endearing with their quirks and all of the outrageous things that they say. The powerhouse cast is led by the talents of the great David Tennant who can do no wrong. Then we have veteran Stanley Tucci channeling a cold character yet we just can't help but be fascinated. The three female leads (playing the journalist, wife, and hostage) are unknown to me, but are equally fantastic. If you want a short package of a rich plot with satisfying twists and turns, then "Inside Man" would not disappoint.

I watched all of this and when it ended I was disappointed. A fine cast for sure but what sunk it was the frankly ludicrous actions of the vicar & his wife. Yes of course it's just a drama but they were stupid beyond belief. Another major problem was that the story was way better in America than in the UK.By far the best thing in this was Stanley Tucci & his sidekick Dillon and I also liked Dolly Wells as Janice. There was also a good cameo from Kate Dickie. Like most dramas this started out promisingly and ran out of steam. The story was just too crazy and the last episode became annoying very quickly.

I really, really wanted to enjoy it, but it was more frustrating than anything. The entire plot is based on completely implausible situations. This is not scifi so suspending my disbelief to a non existing level is not something I want to be doing.There was only one likeable character in this show and annoyingly enough it was the serial killer. Why? I honestly wanted everyone in that show to die.The acting was decent on all accounts but unfortunately the script, plot (is it really a plot if there's nothing but holes?) and the AGGRAVATING cliff hangers/Stanley Tucci's character's faux mysteriousness made it a painful watch which thankfully only lasted 4 hours. Please don't make a sequel as the post credits scene suggests. Only way I'd watch it is as a drinking game and take a shot every time someone says "I am/he is/you are a vicar!!!".

Starts off like it could be good... this lasts 15 about minutes. Then it goes from, Yep something good to watch to who wrote this rediculous episode.It's lame that he just threw the USB stick on the side( anyone living on another earth knew what was on it before she plugged it in.It gets worse then saying it was his without even looking at the images, then as a priest swearing on everyone and everything he supposedly loves and believes in that the child porn on the stick was his... It gets worse.. chasing her hitting her head, pushing her down the stairs, locking her in the cellar..???. Over what! Some sicko from church.

Much better than expected based on the early reviews. It is slightly confusing at the start as it seems to be two completely separate stories that have been cobbled together as neither would have worked on their own. Once you have worked out the link and the character relationships it becomes a really intriguing plot, difficult to stop watching. This is listed as Drama/Mystery, which it is, however it is so bizarre in places and has many dead-pan one liners that it has the feel of black comedy that became too dark. Maybe it started out as a black comedy and the writer decided it was becoming to dark, or perhaps it was pitched as a black comedy but the producers decided make it darker. Either way it works!

Just FYI, I stopped watching during a scene where a flash drive came into question. WFT is all I could say. The W stands for why. Just mind blowing stuff. There's no way in hell anyone, and I mean anyone would do what DT's character does. It is so far fetched as to be offensive to the viewer. Ridiculous. Tucci's character is brilliant. But not enough to make up for the sheer idiocy of the other. The scenes with Tucci and his cell mate are riveting and hilarious at times. The opening scene alone is enough to make you stop watching. I'm not trying to turn anyone away from watching. But I would love to slap the writer just once and ask WTF were you thinking?!

reviews.review_title: The most infuriating thing I have ever watched - do not waste your time
reviews.content: Do not waste your time, wow. The only thing going for this was the cast, but if you respect any of the actors in this show - don't watch any further than where you are up to. Oh my sweet Jesus this is so painful to watch, I wanted to stab my eyes out. In no human god forsaken world would ANYONE BE THAT DUMB (The Vicar). The choices he makes throughout this show could not be further from what would even remotely happen in real life, by the end of the show I was just hoping they all died, the lot of them. I swear to god if this show ever gets signed on for another season, I'll start a petition to ensure it gets cancelled. WASTE OF TIME. WORST PLOT I HAVE EVER SEEN. GIVE ME MY 4 HOURS BACK.

reviews.review_title: Incredibly frustrating writing tropes greatly limited its potential.
reviews.content: I'm fine with suspending disbelief for a good story but when the entire premise is based on the possibility inherent in day to day reality, that's a lot more painful to do. Maybe it's a personal pet peeve but I simply can't stand when a story entirely hinges on multiple characters being way too pushy, entitled and hurried and the characters opposite them being completely incapable of communicating the very simple points that would clarify the misunderstandings that are the only reason for the intense conflict.When a character who communicates for a living can't give the detailed explanations that would help remedy their extreme dilemma, I'm just too frustrated to care anymore. I just hate that writing trope and it happened over and over again with multiple characters and situations of contention. One would be way more pushy than is normal and the other would panic wildly and not offer the obvious words that that would end the conflict and things compound from there. It's hard to explain but I've seen it in storytelling so many times and it's infuriating to watch. You don't see it very often anymore in good productions but when it shows up its just far too ridiculous and obviously just a lazy way of putting the characters in direct, intense conflict.In only this follwing paragraph, some almost spoilers ahead, I'll reference specific instances very vaguely, so it won't truly spoil anything but if u have seen it, you'll know what I'm talking about. If u don't want to chance it, skip this following paragraph.There's also several plot points and character behaviors that just don't add up or maybe are pheasible but added to everything else, further enraging to watch. If only our innocent family had thought about the fact that if police can trace who's computer it came from,which they can do and the lead made mention of twice, THEN U DONT HAVE A PROBLEM. And if you're thinking along those lines, why the hell are we repeatedly using our devices to Google things and email things which would certainly implicate us? If the manipulative "victim" were so clever, why didn't she ever clue in to the fact that the most reasonable explanation for her circumstances would be that what the family was saying was true or at least discuss it with them and get more information instead of jumping to conclusions and putting everyone in their respective corners... or maybe, just maybe, stop focusing on how clever you are for one moment and notice that the person supposedly responsible for the material at the heart of this, keeps asking questions about it which make it BLATANTLY obvious that he knows nothing about the contents and therefore could not be responsible for them.I liked the idea of the characters and their conflict but the execution was excruciating to watch. It's really such a shame because there were a lot of likeable, interesting aspects to most of the characters. There was much more potential than was achieved. The acting was all brilliant all around, I don't mean that. The direction was middling, I wanted to shove the cameraman off the merry go round in the park scene with the reporter and the Scottish thief, dear God, I got vertigo from watching two people sit still and talk. But the plot and the limitations placed on the characters robbed it severely.The concept was a good one, sort of... the central idea was that ordinary, decent people can become murderers in the right circumstances. This concept is true and should be better explored and understood. But it's laughable when they lump serial killers with ribcage magazine racks and pedophiles with obvious psychological damage and behavioral disorders in with them like they're all the same... they aren't. And this was a poor example of when that is true. Sure, people do stupid things all the time, especially when freaked out enough to murder someone, but the characters were so distractingly shoehorned into contention by the writer and denied the common sense solutions to their misunderstandings every single time. It's just incredibly aggrevating to watch. There were aspects of most of the characters that I really liked... it could have been so much better. There's some great humor in it, which I really enjoyed. And occasionally there was a really pure moment of honest humanity and true psychology. But overall, I resented watching it.

reviews.review_title: Waste of 4 hours of my life.
reviews.content: The only good things about it this series is the house, fabulous doors and furniture, and Stanly Tucci. The banter between him and Dillion is great and I've always loved Tucci!!The rest of this show is ridiculous!! Something that would never happen is followed by something else that would never happen!! It's a big snowball of garbage!!I kept watching until the end to see if it would get better. To see if there was some twist or imaginative ending that made the show worth while, but it never happened.This series was recommended by a coworker and I sure won't take that persons recommendations again!!! What a waste of 4 hours of my life!!

reviews.review_title: Oh my days, how bad is this?
reviews.content: Confession, turned it off 5 minutes in. Starts off with a ludicrous scene on this packed Tube carriage. A lout harasses this passenger and everyone else initially just ignores it. This other passenger takes a picture and, get this, hands her phone over to the lout when he demands it. The lout deletes the picture (of course he knew the passcode to the phone) Ha ha ha. Clearly written by 3 monkeys with sunglasses on. Then all of a sudden people pluck up the courage but only by using mobile phones. All of them women, give me a break. The police arrest the lout at the next stop without a shred of evidence, apparently being ugly and dressed in garish clothing is enough to get arrested in modern London.The victim and one helper share words of thanks and pats-on-the-back outside of the station which goes beyond embarrassing. The police never take any statements from anyone. That's when I thought maybe I'll fix that dodgy looking shelf after all. Steven moffat has now become bywords for stinkers.

reviews.review_title: Really Bad: Hideous Characters. Implausible behaviour. Completely unrealistic
reviews.content: The idea was interesting and could have been made into an interesting plot, but boy, what a disaster. All the characters were unlikeable, especially the Vicar and Janice. Every character behaved in ways that were so unrealistic and ridiculous that I was rolling my eyes and shaking my head at how stupid and unbelievable the script was. There were countless plot holes and the 'ethical' reason why Stanley Tucci's character mutilated and beheaded his wife was left unexplained; probably because the writers clearly couldn't think of one. I would definitely give this one a miss and avoid disappointment.

What an adult and intriguing look at the reality of crime and punishment. This is not your typical thriller nonsense with caricatures of good and evil. And that is why it offends simpletons.This is a very deep and profound look at humanities' fraility. When two very good people are forced into a desperate situation through no evil intent or even evil actions, we are left in a world that is not easy to navigate. What an amazing show!It is far too good for TV and probably beyond the intellectual ability of most viewers. An amazing piece of work.If you are someone who likes philosophy, psychology and does not cling to pat answers, polite lies and small talk, you will enjoy this show. If you prefer the repetition of buzz phrases this is not for you.

reviews.review_title: One wrong move even with good intentions could end up dragging you into hell
reviews.content: I watched it because of Steven Moffat and I can't believe that I hate it so much until I would be so motivated to review it here.I like the idea of this series, but the more I watched it the more I got irritated, every minute of me watching it is just me giving the storyteller the benefit of the doubt. Especially the part where the police are having a conversation with the vicar. It was plain torture and I can feel my brain going numb. If that was his intention, then... Brilliant.I understand the intention behind the story, correct me if I'm wrong, but for me, it was about the consequences of being impulsive, desperations and the idea of trying to be clever at the wrong time. Essentially one wrong move even with good intentions could end up dragging you into hell. But I just cannot bear watching people being idiots for hours!It feels so meta when I realize I had good intentions to support Steven Moffat's brilliant work, and I end up torturing myself for some hellish hours. Why? Because the cast and the performances were awesome.I feel like I need to find some sort of support group to talk about this because I am still fuming.

Started out as an intriguing plot. As the series progressed, it became more unbelievable. To the point that I had to turn it offThe creators must think the audience are idiots to buy this plot line. Although the acting is good. Cinematography good it cannot help this terrible plot.At first I thought it might be based on a true story. Then the research I did found it to be fiction.Even though I turned it off, I did end it by watching all four episodes. It was a good lesson in bad writhing.I like crime thrillers. I was hoping this series might be that. Sadly it fails in that category.A waste of time.

Thank You Moffat for creating something so marmite and bonkers that the haters will hate and lovers will love. It's brilliant, crazy and poignant all at the same time. From reading others reviews this will split opinion - but hey at least his Dr Who was good not like Chibnall's rubbish!!!Tennant is spiralling into despair while Wells controls the situation manipulating the collapsing world of Tennant and his family. Add to that the brilliant, quietly spoken genius of Tucci and his sidekick Estimond and you have a perfect storm developing.All that needs to happen is Moffatt deliver an A1 ending and this is a classic. Love it 😊

reviews.review_title: Has Moffat forgotten how humans acts?
reviews.content: Ok, I did like quite a bit of the first episode: it's delightfully weird, there are multiple stories unfolding, the pace of narration is pretty good - not too slow, not too fast, - no exposition dumps.BUT. The first scene in the train is just... Really? You expect me to believe that a journalist who investigates serial killers on death row is afraid to flip off a jerk on a train, and the jerk on a train who's ballsy enough to bully someone with a train full of people watching him in real life is suddenly afraid of some stranger's facebook?Get a grip Steve. I've pushed past this, and I'll keep watching, but damn you were so busy writing about vampires and aliens that you forgot how to human.

Talk about a unique series, wow. Ver good - bravo! The writing is excellent and quite in-depth so one really has to pay attention. I have to admit, I did get a little lost, so I must watch this again. Maybe this time I will find that missed story morsel that will tie that final bow on this package. The pace of the story was superior to many that I have seen of late. There are things happening all around the globe - seemingly not connected. If this had been handled any differently I doubt I would have sat through more than two episodes. The high quality actors kept me glued to the tube. Mix great talent with a great script and let a director actually direct, the end-result is sure to be a winner. 'inside Man' is a winner, truly enjoyable and very cerebral.

This is not funny, it is not comical, but it is the worst crime series that I've ever seen. It is stupid in so many ways that it would take forever to write. It is so naive, pointless and stupid that it keeps you watching and as soon as you think that it can't get worse, voilà, even more stupidity kicks in. Whoever made this, should reconsider their profession, because television, films certainly isn't for them. When you see the actors, it may fool you that there is some value here, however, it seems that these actors won't find any new roles after this horrible series. If I could find more words how horrible this is, I would add it, so the worst it is.

reviews.review_title: So bad and such a waste of time
reviews.content: Somehow I ended up watching all 4 episodes but only because I couldn't believe that well known and respected actors actually agreed to participate in such a frustrating and a completely implausible piece of crap. No one, not even a completely insane person would ever act like any of these people ever. The warden? Wtf! Janice was so completely annoying I was begging for her to die. The only semi likable characters were Mary, the vicar's wife, and Dillon, the other guy on the death row. Also what in hell is this ending? Please for humanity's sake don't make another season of this nonsense. I love Stanley Tucci and the reason I started this was because of him and this almost diminishes that love.

reviews.review_title: For those of us who like shows that are BRILLIANT and remember it's a SHOW!!
reviews.content: Loved this show I've read some reviews and a lot put to much stock into the story not being believable well that could be I think its possible but that's not important it's a tv show you're suppose to check reality at the door. I mean come on LORD of the rings? Star wars? Godzilla? Thor? The terminator? Michael meyers the bible I could keep going the fact is many stories have been told that are engaging and more importantly ENTERTAINING. That's all series and movies have to be ENTERTAINING if it fills that void if it in anyway engages you it's done its job. This series is phenomenal it has it all great acting tension some comedy we think great plot and a fantastic ending. So put aside those prejudices and watch all 4 episodes you'll be throughly ENTERTAINED and come on David Tennant and Stanley Tucci does it get any better than that..... I THINK NOT!! Whole cast is phenomenal. BRAVO!!!

I am a bit confused about the bad ratings. Maybe the story has some plotholes, some decisions taken by the characters are utterly stupid but how things turn out is awsome, unexpected and so crazy that I loved it. Being someone who watches a lot of shows, I am always thinking what will happen next and if I cannot predict it, when something completely out of the world happens, I am hooked.And watching David Tennant is a pleasure. Watch it till the end and you won't regret it. Reminds me a bit of Fargo season 1. Craziness. I strongly suggest viewers to not rate it based only on episode one or two.

This needs to be an ongoing series with Stanley Tucci at the helm.A+++ performances from the aforementioned, as well as David Tennant, Atkins Estimond & Dolly Wells.I would love to see Stanley Tucci takes this further with the witty and dark writings of Steven Moffat.Binge watched the 4 episodes with no hesitation.Wasn't sure what to expect but - even with some less than dynamic acting performances from minor cast - I was reeled in...& would love to stay in Jefferson Grieff's world.Well written, not your normal expected story-line - which is the grab & some stellar acting.This is a part Stanley Tucci was meant to play - give me more!!

Why do reviewers, watch one episode and then post a review that should be set aside for the whole series?Yes, there are a few incredulous happenings here but there are lists of great twists and turns.I am not always a fan of David Tennant but this is probably the best role I have seen him in since Broadchurch (I gave up on Dead water Fell after half an episode and Des was a difficult role being about a ream person but this allowed him to get into character).The annoying thing is having a few familiar support artists that distract you because you know them from somewhere but can't think where (Lydia West from its a sin, Edgar's mum from a touch of frost and Grieff's father in law whom played Endeavour's dad).The first three and a half episodes are great but it does fall apart in the final episode, so often the way that the writer doesn't know how to round things off.An entertaining watch and death row permitting there maybe room for a series 2 but one is probably quite enough.

This might say more about me than the miniseries but I found it to be a hilariously funny dark, comedy of errors. We've got two stories going. The vicar and his family is a comedy of errors, one bad decision piling on top of another with no one thinking rationally. And the few times his wife thinks rationally no one's answering the phone. The second story, the fellow on death row is mildly amusing, mildly confusing. That's where most of the plot questions I have that weren't answered remain. No one's mentioned that you should watch this beyond the credit end there's an extra scene there. I think people should give it a chance. Do you like British murder and British comedy it's a lovely combination of both.

Quite entertaining not perfect but entertaining i dont understand the low ratings this is an easy 7 and hard 8 i assume acting of grieff or tucci was cool and smart i like him as an actor ... some stupid moments but i guess that was the movie about lols... over all its an entertaining series.. hope it has more episodes .. i am rating it at 8 .. since i was entertained by it .. i binge it in one go .. they are some things left in the movie since there was some issue about the case it feels why do they have to show that if they will not finish it lol anyway i guess thats not the plot of the whole story.

This is a brilliant study in the human psyche and how we can all react in very different ways when something unexpected goes wrong. In this case it goes very badly wrong, and the characters act in different and unexpected ways. The tension builds, and although some reactions are not what most people would do (I think), they are believable and possible under the harrowing circumstances here.The acting is impeccable, the settings are amazingly well done, and the writing is truly brilliant. David Tennant and Stanley Tucci are awesome as the 2 main characters, with first rate actors supporting them. Definitely very very watchable, please suspend your disbelief and give it a go, it is worth watching for the human interest factor alone.

reviews.review_title: Weirdly dark and comical at the same time
reviews.content: This show pulled me in within the first 15 minutes. The storyline is a complicated, frustrating mess from the off. It is a reminder how anyone can find themselves in a predicament which leads them to do silly things that they would never have thought possible. The first episode is the best for comic value but the episodes get a little darker as they go along and the last is the most frustrating but not in a bad way. It is just like the characters. All likeable, but annoying because of the things they do. This is definitely set up for a sequel and I will be tuning in. Very smart script and so very watchable.

OK, the plot is ridiculous, and it's silly, but that's the point. However, the acting, film work and writing were very good. It's well worth a watch. I think it owes a nod and a wink to The Lady Killers. That's all I have to say, but apparently I need to make this review 600 characters long.So David Tennet looks good in a beard, and if you can have such an amazing house, then I may well consider being a vicar. I liked the tumble weed scene, though on reflection, I'm not sure that happen. I once visited Alcatraz, so the prison cells look sort of right, but they were quite generous in size, though privacy would be an issue.,

Finally something I have not seen before. I saw real people in situations they have never dreamt of dealing with. They make choices, as in life, mostly not the right ones and while they try to make things better, things get just worse.Some reviewer are complaining about "plot holes", but I think it is just life, we must play our roles without knowing the scenario.David Tennant and Stanley Tucci are fabulous - as always, make the characters and their actions totally credible.As for me, I would really like to see a new season, where Stanley Tucci is solving cases with his inmate, Dillon - , just like Sherlock and Watson.

Like I don't even wanna start with the plot holes because the whole thing was a colander. But .. i was so mad watching it. No normal person would never do these things ever. It all starts with a misunderstanding and after people get locked in bassements and get killed. This was all SOOOOO BAD AND ANNOYING OMG. All the characters except the inside man were super frustrating to watch and I just wanted them all to die honestly, especially Janice and the vicar... like this stupidity.. I cannot it was painfull to watch the scenario was very bad please don't watch it you will get disappointed from how dumb they think we are.

Abominable waste of an amazing cast. This is one of the single most stupid scripts that's ever been put into production. The escalation from the inciting incident on the Tennant plotline is so extreme and unbelievable that it's nearly impossible to watch. The Tucci plotline is dull and cartoonish at the same time. The cast works as well as they can with the silly lines they've been given. Honestly on par with Kristen Bell's Woman in the Window parody - there's no way this could really be considered a serious drama; it must be comedy. Moffat has always been convinced of his own cleverness, and stains his characters with the same smarmy attitude. Don't bother watching.

Great actors - Tucci & Tennant - WASTED due to laughably bad writing.how does stuff this stupid/ implausible etc. Ever get turned into movies/TV? Disconnected, just plain dumb. Seemingly disparate stories someone not terribly clever (who THOUGHT he/she is terribly clever) thought could be weaved together, but there are so may loose ends & glossed over connections that are laughably implausible. . . As my wife exclaimed when it was mercifully over "We'll, that was 4 hours of our lives we'll never get back, that were totally wasted." Great case of getting sucked in by occasional pithy lines & feeling like 'it's gotta get better' so you stay to the bitter end. But it never does. Never. Even the acting by David Tennant was substandard- how do you do that? The only really good moment in the 4 hours was the 15 second scene in which his wife is killed - a deliciously deserving moment - if this was real life, I'd say '' Too bad it didn't happen about 20 years prior."

You can tell Stephen Moffat and crew were very pleased with themselves when they came up with the concept. Trouble is, they weren't smart enough to realize they don't know how to write mysteries.There are two halves to this show... David Tennant as the possible murderer in England, and Stanley Tucci as the death row detective in America. The England part is... pretty good? But Tucci's detective set-ups and resolutions are laughably unrealistic. You can poke holes in his "detective work" in two seconds.The show just feels cutesy. There's a potential interesting story with the (possible) murderer being a good man who thinks he can remain good. The show could have been about that and left the Tucci character on the cutting room floor. Good actors wasted.

I have to admit, my 1 star rating is not accurate. If i could i would give it negative 5. Don't get me wrong, the idea of Stanley Tucci being a detective from jail is so great deserves its own series. The actors are good... But that is the whole problem, all this is wasted by the writing... In fact the writer must have no idea how human beings react in real life. He must have a strange little universe in his head, where, for instance, a vicar is willing to do "ANYTHING FOR HIS SON", except of course, give up the Verger who is truly a pedophile. Essentially, everything is so needlessly stupid and contrived, you could be forgiven for giving it a positive 5 as a not so funny comedy with an even more contrived ending.

2 stars for the actors who were great. I didn't know how to watch this series.... I kept wondering whether it was meant to be a comedy or a serious thriller. The opening scene suggests Moffat wants us to understand that it's serious. However that means that every scene, including the actions of EVERYONE in the opening scene were very stupidly written and unbelievable. We're meant to believe that a vicar who is so magnanimous as to protect a paedo and his son then just treats others like Janice as rag dolls pushing them down the stairs and falsely imprisoning them. It's beyond the realms of believability. It's classic Moffat which is why I quickly gave up on Sherlock. Dillon is the light-hearted sidekick but he's murdered 14 women and that gets the laughs? Perhaps I'm becoming Victor Meldrew in my older age.

I'm fully hooked! I Don't understand all the hate it's a bit of fun! I'm 3 episodes in and would definitely say a 9/10 so far!Tucci is brilliant, his character is likable and interesting. As well as his sidekick with the photographic memory. They are quite funny together.David Tennant's character is a bit annoying, and does make questionable decisions, but it's all part of the mad storyline.I say just watch it and enjoy the suspense and mad storyline. At the end of the day it's entertainment...and I am fully entertained.Can't wait for the last episode, this week is gunna go so slowwwww!

reviews.review_title: Completely waste of time and nerves.
reviews.content: So, the plot is completely stupid, apparently nobody heard about 911 or 112 or the police. All characters are dystopic and acting distopic, sorry I wanted to say extremely stupid, even extremely stupid is not enough to describe the level of improbability of facts that occur in this movie.The acting is ok, i appreciate Stanley Tucci alors and the actors work deserves to be praised considering the facts. I find it extremely hard to deliver, to act, when the screenplay is so, so, so disconnected from reality. I will be very disappointed if it will be a sequel.Anyway, i was relieved whet it ended.

reviews.review_title: Good performances but to many unanswered questions
reviews.content:
My Review- Inside ManMy Rating 6.5 /10Netflix from October 31stI was lucky to see an advanced copy of this upcoming four part series and while I enjoyed the performances in Inside Man it left me with to many unanswered questions .Inside Man follows a prisoner on death row in the US, a Vicar in a quiet English town, and a maths teacher trapped in a cellar, as they cross paths in the most unexpected way
I especially enjoyed Stanley Tucci as Jefferson Grieff a man on Death Row convicted of murdering his wife also David Tennant as the local village Pastor Harry Watling . Harry the trusted village Pastor makes a decision when he is confronted with the sins of his verger that will throw his well ordered family life into unimaginable turmoil.The two real problems that I had with the story by Steven Moffat was that the two characters and two stories didn't gel or have credibility for me .The decision that the Pastor makes by taking the blame for the discovery of his vergers child pornography in an effort to protect his son Ben played by Louis Oliver from being blamed just seemed unfathomable to me?Why didn't he just report the crime of the verger to the Police?Without giving any more plot details away the Stanley Tucci character while entertaining also baffled me a little because a prisoner on death row would hardly be given the privileges this one has of visits from journalists and be asked to assist as a super sleuth in various ways that don't connect to the Pastor's story till the very end of the series .Perhaps I just didn't get it ? But even in quirky Dramadies I like a little logic in the plot and this series ,especially in the last episode turns to the melodramady genre .However I think it's worth a watch for the two T's Tucci and Tennant plus a very good performance by Dolly Wells as Janice Fife the edgy maths tutor of Ben the vicar's son who lands herself in deep trouble by her incorrect assumptions regarding her student Ben .I interpret the title Inside Man as not just a reference to prison inmates inside gaol . The message , if any I got was that if a set of traumatic circumstances present themselves inside us all we have the capacity to murder ,especially if panic sets in and also that every action has a consequence.Steven Moffatt is obviously a very talented story writer but this one for some reason left me with to many unanswered questions,

reviews.review_title: Twisted, everything that could go wrong, does...
reviews.content: The most likable characters were the two on Death Row. By the end of the series it would have been fine with me if all had met their maker, except those two convicted murderers. Stanley Tucci was fantastic as always. The writing was consistently excellent, as was the acting. It's ironic that the most twisted, morally bankrupt character was the vicar, played by David Tennant. The line "everyone's a murderer on the wrong day" or something like that is as chilling as it probably is true. I have no idea if this will get renewed for more episodes but I'd watch more.Inside Man was annoying as hell, but fiendishly watchable.

The only downfall is David Tennent isn't bumbling enough but otherwise he's convincing as a man of God torn by his accidental accidents.Stanley Tucci is immaculate, as usual.I found it entertaining and thought provoking. The conversation is witty and makes you laugh even in tense situations.Could I murder someone under the right circumstances?How much do our actions impact others?Is anyone truly able to get away with murder?Can you ever truly trust even the people you love and live with?How intertwined are all our lives even when we don't realize it? Not six degrees of separation; intertwined.

reviews.review_title: Stupid people making the worst decisions
reviews.content: There's nothing more frustrating to watch on screen than stupid people making terrible decisions. Every time Ben Na Harry appeared on screen I was literally shouting at them to not do anything silly. But of course they do the most contrived silly things. Every character on this show is sketchy and poorly written. The two parallel story lines are joined together by the thinnest thread and the connection makes almost no sense. The plot is so so weak. Acting is ok. A very annoying and slow show. Will not recommend you waste your time on this at all.This review needs more characters to be published so I'm writing this extra sentence :)

reviews.review_title: Script writing at its very best
reviews.content: The people who write negatively about this amaze me. I can only assume they watched with the sound off. There is not one wasted word in this superb drama. Every single line Stanley Tucci utters is a joy of either dark humour or wisdom. The plot while unlikely is both funny and enthralling. We are kept guessing all the way through and every character adds depth and colour to the scenes as this brilliant story unfolds. The acting is of the very highest level, the entire cast give fascinating and riveting performances, and no-one is just going through the motions.I truly can not understand how people can find fault with this great drama. I do hope there is more to come because I want to hear more from Grief.

reviews.review_title: Awful. And I like Tucci and Tennant. So Imagine ....
reviews.content: 'The Inside Man' is awful. And I'm a fan of its stars David Tennant and Stanley Tucci (yes, I know, I've said something like this before, for other films), so imagine how really bad this story must be.And the story is this. A woman disappears in a small English Village and her friend is concerned. Five thousand miles away a killer - Tucci - sits on a U. S. prison's Death Row facing his execution. The English Village friend somehow, and for some reason, approaches killer Tucci's character in person and asks his help in finding her friend. Why Tucci? Why America? Why not the British Police? Why, why, why?Here was my theory. It's WRONG, but a theory. This was initially two separate dramas (a) a killer's execution and (b) the disappearance in Britain and the role that a local clergyman - Tennant - had in her disappearance. But neither story was strong enough on its own so, the Director - Scotch-Tape in hand - combined the two into one. The two stories look and feel totally separate, as though directed and filmed by different individuals. In fact only one character appears in both stories - 'The Concerned Friend' - and easily could have been pasted into either story. Or removed.But as I said, my theory was wrong. But what I'm correct about is how really bad this is.1. David Tennant is hyper-anxious as a cleric protecting his family. I found myself uncomfortable in his presence; not because he's evil but because I felt that even he knew his acting was atrocious.2. The story is has as its center a contrivance that exceeds anything I've ever viewed. A sort-of mistaken-identity. And I've seen lots of mistaken-identity-dramas over the years and this one tops the list for 'Oh no!'3. The action-finale of the story is shot so terribly, with so many quick-cuts, it was hard to know what actually happened. And, more important, once we knew what happened we had to ask, How? How did this happen?4. And, because the director likely knew we'd be asking 'How', the two main characters have a 'Zoom' conversation in the film's final scene. As implausible as this meeting might be, the fact that the Tucci character describes in detail everything that took place 'off-screen', tells you everything you need to know.So, it's up to you. Who you gonna believe? Me or them other guys?

Don't let the low ratings decide for you, watch it and decide by yourself. I was already looking forward to watch it when I first read the plot on Netflix; being a fan of both David Tennant and Stanley Tucci, there was no doubt I would see it.David Tennant never disappoints; brilliant performance, amazing acting as usual. By the end of the first episode, I was already hooked up! You can't actually make your mind about this being a comedy or a thriller; there is a good amount of suspense, but also laughable moments, with mixed feelings.Joining these two amazing actors (David Tennant and Stanley Tucci) a very pleasant Atkins Estimond, actor (for me unknown so far) who also totally captured my attention with his performance. Just watch it.

I can't wait for season 2. I like that there's humor in it. The actors were great. Not sure why some hated it so much. Of course it's gonna be a wacky show it's a show. Not true life.I also really appreciated that there was only four episodes. Many series are too long sometimes and you can't binge it all in one day.The series got better and better with each episode. I was on the edge of my seat by the 4th and could not believe what happened. I prefer movies or series that have happy endings so with this one I was a little disjointed. Not my cup of tea, but certainly it was very interesting. As if that happened. Watch it, watch it, watch it. You'll be surprised how good it is.

The reviews seem very polarizing. It's definitely weird and quirky - some may not like that. But surely it's fun and entertaining. It really hooked me on to binge watch all 4 episodes. It's got a lot of fresh thought and story - hence, not at all predictable and thus very thrilling. There are twists and turns which you can just never guess.The actors did an amazing job - each of the characters draw you in. Can't wait for the next season to come - hope it does. The ending got me curious to wait for more.Can't wait for the next season to come - hope it does. The ending got me curious to wait for more.

I do not understand the negative reviews. If only for the superb acting, it is worth watching. But the story line, while somewhat implausible, kept me glued to the TV for all four episodes in one evening. Trying to figure out the connection between the characters kept me guessing.I am a huge fan of Stanley Tucci and this was a master class.Kudos to the writer. He must have a twisted mind! Excellent work, great script, wonderful supporting cast, in particular the big guy in the next cell to Tucci. His character was excellent and he played it well. If you like a good dark mystery, watch this.

reviews.review_title: Plot is just bonkers! But it works.
reviews.content: First of all, you have to remember this is a fictional drama with hypothetical causes and effects. What would happen if smart characters constantly take the stupidest decisions possible, without pausing to listen to reason? What would happen?Well, this drama is exactly that.The main issue could have been solved in the first 20 minutes of the first episode it self with little bit of good communication, however, that's not why we are here. We are in for the highly entertaining, roller-coaster ride of a dramady that ends in a tragedy.Starring David Tenant and Stanley Tucci, two great actors, delivering great acting skills. Tucci's character is Sherlock Holmes but if he were a criminal, lives in an American Prison, and Tenant is a sexy Vicar who is overly empathetic and has zero logical senses, lives in a small village somewhere in the Great Britain. How are they connected?Well, by a series of misfortune and a villainous (but not quite) extremely tactical and smart "victim" by the name of Janice.Watch it. You'll see what I mean.

Describing the plot won't help because this is all about the tension and this is four episodes filled with tension. People with no criminal sense whatsoever get themselves into a terrible situation and then proceed to make it worse.I see a lot of negative reviews over the plot not being realistic. I think if you read the synopsis about a death row prisoner solving crime, well, no it's not going to be realistic. It's going to be something you either go along for the ride or wait for the next bus.I went along for the ride and it was fun. And maybe ask yourself, could you really commit murder?

What an interesting dillema this series presents. The leading actresses's character was truly frustrating to watch, she pretty much caused her horrible situation based on her actions and her quickness to make the priest a predator in her own mind, where he in turn was forced in a sense to assume the role of predator that she cast upon him. If only she just would have been reasonable and sensible, rather than create the predator/prey scenario that she pretty much forced the priest into. Pinning people into a corner is not a good idea, and creating a scenario where a recording lacking context would be involved is clearly unwise and not the right thing to do.

I tried watching this but couldn't make it through the full season.From the first scene it is clear how cringe worthy this terrible show is.Wade futher into the show and you notice poorly written dialogue and a laughably bad plot.I enjoyed Steven moffatt's stand alone Dr Who episodes, but this is a massive disappointment.It seems he is trying to cover up under developed plots with clever dialogue, but he constantly misses the mark.UK dramas have been garbage for years now. Where is the UK equivalent of Squid Game?British writers are too preoccupied with making sure they are on the correct side of PC culture that they've forgotten to write decent stories.Dr Who - terrible writing
Sherlock - terrible writing
The list goes on and includes Inside Man.Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Steven Moffet! For the love of God!!!
reviews.content: Love Stanley Tucci. Love David Tennant. But! This dumpster fire is a complete piece of crap start to finish. To call the "storyline" incomprehensibly unbelievable is being generous. No one would ever make the decisions that David Tennant's character did. EVER! Slightly less head-smackingly stupid was the wife. Only slightly. Then there's the hostage's INSANE cooperation and behavior. Steven Moffet! What the H were you thinking!Yes. I watched all 4 episode. Why? Because I was hoping at some point Stanley Tucci would start screaming "Please make it stop!" like he did at the end of Joe Somebody."Does this review contain spoilers?" Yes. If you could smell a movie, this movie would smell like spoiled meat.

reviews.review_title: Convoluted and not nearly as clever or witty as it presumes to be.
reviews.content: Convoluted and not nearly as clever or witty as it presumes to be. You would think with great actors on both sides of the pond like David Tennant and Stanley Tucci that this series couldn't miss, but it does. Tucci, who plays a convicted murderer who gives advice to investigators similarly to Hannibal Lecter, reprises his smug foppish character from The Hunger Games which feels obnoxiously inappropriate here and grows very tiresome. It wavers between straight drama and satire, unsure of what it is trying to do. There were a few amusing wisecracks along the way, but the tenuous sub-plots ultimately don't hold it together well and the ending doesn't satisfy.

reviews.review_title: Don't do it to yourself. Find something else to watch instead
reviews.content: Well what a crock of s##t. Nothing about this show stands up whatsoever. Big fan of Stanley Tucci and him and his cell mate are excellent. However Tennant, his wife and Dolly Wells are absolutely awful and very unlikeable throughout. Could've gone maybe 3 or for out of 10 based on the initial premise and first episode BUT come the ending I felt both angry and foolish for dedicating my time to this series. Tried extremely hard to be clever, slick and I'd imagine the creators thought maybe they had created something special. They didnt! With that said, do yourselves a favour and swerve it. Seriously, do not waste your time.

I love David Tennant. I'll watch anything he's in. And that's how I found myself watching one of the worst shows I've ever seen. I knew I hated it and wanted to give up after 30 minutes but my husband hates to give up on shows and wanted to keep watching - it was torture. It was absolutely terrible. Stanley Tucci was great and his character's storyline was the only remotely interesting and redeeming part of the whole thing. Other reviewers have done a great job of explaining why this show is awful, so I will just reinforce that they said and agree that you should watch something else. Literally almost ANYTHING else.

There can be funny british movies with too many accidents to happen to explain to the police - actually some british one as well - "A Film with me in it" from 2008. In my opinion it just works better as a comedy than as a drama. If the series was way shorter, it might work as funny teachable show on not to look at USB sticks with unknown origin. The only thing going for the show is the excellent cast - first and foremost Stanley Tucci and David Tennant, but also the actress playing "Janice" and whom I remember as Dr. Van Helsing from the recent Dracula feature on Netflix. Unfortunately the script can't follow up to that.

reviews.review_title: Why the BBC license fee is a bargain.
reviews.content: What a wonderful ride through an absurd plot with a brilliant ending. This has to be watched with a tongue in cheek mindset. Of course its highly implausible....but so is Star Wars and even Harry Potter!....doesnt stop you enjoying the narrative, action, music, acting, directing and the oh so lovely dark comedy. It is packed with references to other drama.....think Killing Eve and the green cross code incident. Tennant and Tucci are magnetic....one palpably brings the reluctant murderer a credibility; and the other urbanely intellectually legitimises the obscene act through atonement and Sherlock like guesswork.....wonderful construct to bring both protagonists together eventually. The vicarage sets a gothic tone to the plot core....deftly directed, evoking a viscerally claustrophobic atmosphere....cliche rich resonation adds further layers to this homage....think Silence of the Lambs with humour! Ultimately pretentiously thought provoking.....are we all capable of murder??

I really can't understand why this got such bad reviews!!I really, really enjoyed this show.I'm not a massive fan of David Tennant but thought he was great in this.As for Stanley Tucci....the man is a legend...whether this show would have been any good without him in it, is debatable.This show is OTT, off the wall and very unusual, if, like myself, you enjoy a wacky drama and you don't take it too "seriously" you'll love it.It makes a refreshing change to watch something that doesn't take itself too seriously and has an almost comedic theme running through it.Give it a go....what have you got to lose?

Why does the BBC insist on making and promoting awful programmes like this? The whole thing had a strange ,off kilter feel to it with really poor acting and a dire script .The storyline regarding the USB stick and the cellar goes on and on and on. I can only assume that David Tennant is struggling to act as he is also trying to put on a dodgy accent at the same time. There are so many good shows lurking in the background on the BBC but they never get the exposure they deserve as this kind rubbish gets forced on us. How often do you see an advert on the BBC for Snowfall? It was the same story with the appalling Bodyguard series when The informant was a far superior programme but was barely mentioned.

Anything with Stanley Tucci in it is going to be brilliant, add David Tennant and you have something special. Family life at the manse goes from bad to worse, from worse to catastrophic. The script is intelligent well written and although there are a few hard to believe scenarios it still keeps you guessing as to what is going to happen next. Only four episodes with all nearly an hour long. All supporting actors were first class, especially the vicors wife. There is some blood and gore but not enough make you switch off, it's all in context with nothing over the top. So, grab a drink, lower the lights sit back and enjoy.

Can't blame the terrific actors, but the writing in this drama/thriller is too atrocious for words. The characters and their motivations are idiotic. Some plot twists will keep you watching, but the continuous string of idiocy, coincidences and moronic actions by the characters, narrated by an interesting Stanley Tucci whose almost non stop philosophical nonsense becomes annoying, will make you wonder what the heck you're watching.The only good thing, besides the actors, is that you'll actually be curious for how bad it's gonna end, the same way you need to see a car wreck, to make the traffic jam worthwile.

Stumbled across this by accident and so glad I did! Nearly didn't watch it after reading some of the reviews, but the bad reviews are far more bonkers than the actual show and that's saying a lot!If you're reading this before you watch it just carry on, go for it, you won't regret it. Don't be put off by the bad reviews, they're nuts! A lot of these reviews don't even seem to understand what's happening. One in particular stands out as it questions who the woman in the basement is, saying there's no explanation! Really?Anyway, basically great characters, great acting and a different and unpredictable storyline. Love it 😊

reviews.review_title: A great premise totally let down by a preposterous plot
reviews.content: What could have been a really clever, unusual and morally challenging concept is let down by a dreadful script (shame on you Steven Moffat) and a storyline so full of holes that you could drain pasta in it.About a dozen times in each episode you just feel like screaming at the screen because the lack of consistency and logic in what clearly prides itself to be a masterly devised story is absolutely enraging. A series with such strong moral dilemmas the protagonists have to face, should have a watertight plot that is driven by events and characters' actions that are necessary and unavoidable. Instead things feel all pretty random and leave you with a very bad taste in your mouth.I'd strongly advise to avoid this series.

This was a really awful show. Especially considering the fact that you had Stanley Tucci and David Tennant to work with. Horrible script. Pathetic plot. Boring characters. I blame myself for watching the whole thing. I don't need a happy ending, but I actually think it would have worked here. And what happened to the wife was just criminal. I am so sick of shows about people's lives falling apart in crisis. Crime dramas are great, but can we have them say something? There was certainly a Silence of the Lambs quality to this show. I was intrigued by the premise. But the execution was a big failure for me.

reviews.review_title: Star power wasted on terrible writing
reviews.content: Absolutely abysmal writing. It's hard to convey in words how stupid all of these characters must be for this plot to exist. Surely the intent was to slowly build tension, but the experience here is more akin to irritation - as David Tennant makes increasingly stupid choices to cover for his previous stupid choices. The honest truth is that halfway through episode 3, I paused the stream in a fit of frustration and thought to myself, what is the dumbest way this situation in the basement could resolve itself? I didn't realize just how prophetic my guess would be. Frankly, I'm ashamed to be on a such a similar wavelength as Moffat.You'll find yourself cursing this show, and it's writers, and eventually yourself for watching it. It's much too late for me, but you may still avoid the anguish.Also, be warned: If you're enjoying Stanley Tucci's performance in episode one, you'll be surprised how little he appears in the rest of the show, and how irrelevant he is to the proceedings.

reviews.review_title: Goes from 10 star to 1 star in no time-RIP Producers
reviews.content: What an awful show by these 2 clowns Alex Mercer & Ben Irving. I wasted 4 hours of my life just to realise they dont know how to end the show. Word of advice to these 2 grandpas, if you dont know how to end a show , dont start with one. This was one of the worse ending, even worse than LOST. And exactly what was the thought given to ending of show, so vicar just murdered her or not. What was the point of sending down men with shovels. Why did craig kill her wife and where is her head. So many un-answered questions and what an AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL way to end the show. Please do yourself a favour and dont produce any shows and join a theater or something. For the people reading this, they pretent to show vicar is killing her in basemnnt but apparently shes not dead and vicar is arrested for what exactly.

reviews.review_title: One star for David Tennant and Stanley Tucci showing up.
reviews.content: I had high hopes that this would be a really well written crime drama. It wasn't.There was no character introduction, except to say that Tennant's vicar appeared to be a popular person in the parish.Suddenly, he turned into gullible fool, committing the most unbelievably far fetched acts of stupidity and violence, even then I still believed it would be a good story, until the oddly cast wife went along with it.Tucci's character had no build up whatsoever, and seemed to only be there because he was available.Was it a dark comedy ?? Wasn't funny in the least.I stuck it out to the bitter end, but my advice to others is just don't waste your time.It's even more annoying that we pay a TV tax to watch this banal rubbish.

I guess, after perusing some of the reviews, that I am one of the few who really enjoyed series.It starts out bewilderingly in an American prison and then switches to an English village, but if you stick with, it all comes together.I found the acting superb. The plot? Somewhat implausible. The Tucci part. Interesting, though.The central situation, the thing between the pastor and his son's tutor, is entirely believable.It's one bad decision after another on the part of the pastor. The denouement is fantastic. The last half hour had me sitting on the edge of my chair, screaming "Call the police!!!."
I loved it. The script could have been better but it has wonderful actors and gripping elements.I am going to watch it again.

There are some great moments in this series. But too much is left unexplained at the end. Miscommunication, timely phone calls, frustrating unrealistic decisions, are what drives the plot. Some of that is expected (this is a tv show after all) but to have it be that persistent...
And it's just remarkably depressing.The motivations of the tutor are never explained, and she does a lot that is in need of explanation. Or does it just fill the 2nd and 3rd episodes with more false suspense?I wish I hadn't watched it. But here I am, now struggling to forget it. No redeeming qualities to the characters, no redeeming quality to its viewing.

It isn't often that I give up on something but this managed it. Despite some reservations after the slightly cringeworthy "me too" opening scene I decide to persevere and see where it went. However as the show progressed the actions of Tennant's Vicar became less and less plausible and as that happened my interested waned. I'm trying to think of positive things to say, but I'm actually struggling. I really wanted to like this as I think Tennant is an amazing actor but Moffat's writing - as always - was way off the mark and I can't honestly see why the BBC decided this was worthy of production.I eventually gave up part way through episode 3 and I'm now left mourning two and a bit hours of my life I'll never get back.

Ridiculous/tired/over exaggerated premise which has been done better many times before. It starts poorly with an unrealistic situation on a tube train, don't get me wrong, I'm sure this type of behaviour unfortunately does happen, it's just the other people's reactions. There would be far more people with their phones out than one woman who doesn't even have a Facebook account. It's like Steve Moffat has never heard of Tik-tok. As for the way the vicar reacts....I hope it gets better than this first episode as on the basis of this one alone, it's not worth sticking with. Steve Moffat is better than this.

I'm not entirely sold on Steve Moffitt, but his work is usually interesting enough to watch. However, I was simply blown away by how awful this was. It felt like the intention was to write a thriller by numbers, relying on massively over-used cliches, paying no regard whatsoever to whether it was remotely believable - which it wasn't! I stuck with it thinking it might get better, but it actually got worse. The last episode had me burying my head in my hands in despair. I am not going to say the acting was bad, as the cast featured some top people and I imagine they delivered exactly the performances required. It was just a bad idea from start to finish, and it is hard to believe that nobody involved realised quite how bad it was.

It started out pretty well, in my opinion. Seemed like a witty, if dry, British take on the Hannibal trope.Then, half way through the first episode, the show loses momentum, and it seems like the script writers started to employ the writing by whim method. Every idea they could come up with seems to be thrown into four times one hour episodes.Unbelivable plot and poor character development, so half the time you're left wondering why a character behaved the way they did.Poorly conceived, written and executed. There are so many good shows out there. No need to force yourselves through this one.The vicar is a bad guy. How novel.

I liked this but the Beth character and the Janice character were sooooo annoying! Karen comes to mind for the Janice character. It is good to get involved with situations that may not seem right but you cannot play a police officer or god if you do. Get the facts right before you try to wreck somebodies life like some Karen's do under the guise of "helping".The Beth character was also annoying. She could not figure anything out (I figured it out before she did) and she is a horrible actress. I think they cast that character wrong for the sake of being pc.Over all it is a good watch since some of it was clever and u love Stanley Tucci.

Fab cast fed a load of guff pretending to be a dramatic script. Tucci and Tennent do their best, and in fairness, Tucci gets the better half of the deal as a Hannibal lite character. The U. K. side of things however........what a mess. Another reviewer asks the question "why does it have to be believable"? Well, it's not a fantasy, it's not a supernatural tale, and it's not sci-fi.......you have to look at the character's actions in a contemporary setting and reconcile in your own mind that those actions are within the bounds of credibility.......and a vicar who takes on the persona of a mildly threatening Mr Bean who is wed to either Thelma or Louise just isn't credible......and dramas need to be credible.I cannot bring myself to criticise Tennent or Tucci. The script and plot however.........horrendous.

reviews.review_title: Very good people, very bad writing..
reviews.content: It's like a baby was given a pen and a piece of paper and was asked to write what a plot twist is, but couldn't write anything -cause it's a baby ofc- so it just barf onto the paper and that paper was later given to Moffat, so he could write the first letters he could see on the barfy paper. But wait! What's that? The baby IS Moffat?!?!It doesn't make sense, right? Yeah, so does this!The only thing that will remain as a good memory is that you get to see David Tennant. You know, just looking at him is a marvellous experience. Also watching Stanley Tucci was very nice too. Although it was such a shame to waste him in such a mess of a plot.

reviews.review_title: Silence of the Lambs but with an absurd script
reviews.content: It's difficult to describe just how awful this mini-series is. Never mind that two death row murderers are left simply handcuffed in a cell with a Senator or a young woman. Never mind that the premise is "everyone is a murderer if they meet the right person". Never mind that the warden of a maximum security prison just walks up to and casually chats with prisoners within arms length.The entire premise of the show is absurd. Stanley Tucci, who is very talented, is very good in his role as a criminologist behind bars for murdering his wife. He accepts cases to work on while he awaits the executioner, because that is what happens in maximum security prisoners- outsiders are free to come and go as long as the warden is cool with it.Next we have David Tennant, a great actor as well, but completely unbelievable as an English vicar taking the blame for a heinous crime against children rather than reveal the true culprit who maybe confessed? Absurd.From there it just becomes less and less likely, all the way to kidnapping a masochistic woman who seems eager to be murdered herself.A remarkable waste of talent.

There is great acting talent, decent scenery, and a direction that give the series a mysterious tone.But the plot is no numbingly stupid, unrealistic and borderline criminal that it is hard to watch or care about anything else. It is really just that bad. I'm almost speechless. If you can get past the plot, it may come across as an interesting drama thriller. The director (and David Tennet acting) was trying to balance a tone of comedy and murder, but that usually only works when it is a black comedy with violent pieces. Here this is a drama thriller dealing with very serious violent themes and injecting comedy at the whole time. You almost do not know when to take a scene seriously.If you can make it past the 30 minute mark and do not have the sensation to blow up your tv, then continue watching. If your mouth is still open at 30min mark from the plot line....turn it off.

Yes it was implausible but very clever the way the main characters linked via the plot. The story line was full of surprises and twists and the main characters interesting and well acted. The two US inmates had an ironic gentle chemistry which was a joy to observe. The mathamatics tutor was both proper and quirky, and rarely spoke as you may have expected. The journalist was a strong character who rolled with the punches in her interactions with the US inmates
The drama had my attention from the opening scene on the underground and continued to hold it throughout the 4 hoursHoping for a 2nd series.

One of the biggest criticisms I can make of a bad movie or Tv series is where the writer has to make the characters say, do, or not say or do the most basic of things that every single person would do. The far fetched nature of any fiction can be overlooked if the writing is bang on. This is farce in the worst possible way. Every scenario is contrived in such a way that it is unwatchable. Cringe levels to the max. As fairly intelligent viewer, it doesn't take long to get bored of screaming at the tv that people wouldn't say that, or people would say this. One simple sentence by any of the main characters and there is no plot line. That's bad writing. It needs to have some semblance of actuality. Hated it. Bit smug too.

I was very surprised by this, because on paper it should be great: a great cast, a great writer and a great director should equate to something very memorable, but unfortunately the plot is so unbelievable it's just a frustrating watch.Both narratives are completely implausible and despite some incredible acting talent, the whole piece just doesn't work as it's unashamedly daft.Tennant's vicar just needs to tell the truth and Tucci's convicted murderer would never be allowed to still practise law in a million years.A real shame, as this was a large waste of time for all involved - including the people attempting to watch it.

reviews.review_title: Yikes! Talk About Getting Straight To The Point
reviews.content: Okay, I thought that the premise of the show sounds very interesting and I like David as an actor, so, let's watch it! Immediately at the beginning I'm confronted with a guy "man-spreading" wide like an eagle rubbing his hand on his crotch while looking at the chic sitting across from him. He starts harassing her, then another women, then... 5 minutes in "Toxic masculinity, women fighting back...". Right from the very start some communist feminist man-hating bs. Reminds me of Broadchurch (2013) which started off alright with season one, but went full-commie man-hating trash to the max. Inside Man starts straight off.... ... okay, I'll watch some more and we'll see where it goes... I gave it another half an hour. OMG, absolutely preposterous. I loathe stories where the characters do absolutely insane stupid nonsensical things that nobody in real life would do. You just spend most of your time saying, "Uug, so stupid, why would they do that?" over and over. I'm out. This show is absurd. Who wrote this? What an idiot. As an actor, unless totally desperate, I'd never do a show like this.

reviews.review_title: Forget the plot holes. Just be entertained.
reviews.content: Mostly the comments on here are about how unbelievable the plot (or lack of)is. I ask you to put that aside and focus and be enthralled with the brilliant acting. The numerous never heard before one-liners. There's at least 6 that I've bookmarked to use myself. Of course I'm not going to be a "spoiler".I binged the whole 4 episodes. It certainly wasn't my intention to be writing a review at 3am when I've got a 7am start, but such was my unbridled excitement of this series it just had to be done (not sure my boss will see it like that when I'm on the nod at lunch time). But there you go. That's my take on it. Don't get caught up in the plot, just applaud it for its purely entertaining value, and I promise you won't be disappointed. Cheers Dave.

reviews.review_title: A four-hour shaggy dog story in which everyone behaves absurdly
reviews.content: This starts off silly, with an implausibly woke scene involving crime on a British subway -- menacing white bully, women-of-color victims, lady saves the day -- and grows increasingly silly as it progresses: not silly-fun but silly-irritating. No one behaves remotely like an actual human being; rather, they're like characters in an absurdist stage play.Also irritating is the music: horribly obtrusive, constantly nudging one in the ribs.If you take the whole four-episode series as an extended joke -- and that's probably how it's intended -- you'll stick around, as I did, just to see how the whole wretched thing comes out. On the other hand, if you make the mistake of taking it all too seriously, you'll end up wishing that these ridiculous characters would simply get it over with and kill one another. And you'll regret -- also as I did -- having been trifled with for four hours.

Film makers and story tellers really need to stop using stupidity as a plot device, there are so many ways in which a person can get themselves into a bad spot without making utterly stupid decisions as a human being. However this series just like many others uses the easy way out of trying to further the plot by human stupidity alone. Don't people bounce ideas each other any more? Are writers given such free reign that no one dares to question their weak story writing? This is at best a 4.5 stars but I have to give it a single star to balance out the ridiculously high score that it has. They could have just made it into a comedy of error sort of plot to make it more enjoyable.

I'm a Vicar, and I live in hope that TV writers will be supportive occasionally, rather than completely misrepresent our vocation (which is the usual result). With 'Inside Man' misrepresentation of clergy has, if not reached new depths, has perpetuated the same rubbish you see whenever a TV character is wearing a clerical collar. I am pleased to see all the terrible reviews this show is getting (for different reasons). Some critics seem to be experts in TV production, and acting, and I agree with them that this show is a waste of talent, with extremely poor writing - with intolerable plotholes - that make the show unwatchable. I even lost sleep over how bad this show is. I want my evening back.

reviews.review_title: I cannot believe the low ratings
reviews.content: I binge watched this one afternoon. It started out a little slow and somewhat confusing but I kept watching and it got better and better. I always love Stanley Tucci Who is always awesome and anything he does and it was nice to see David Tennant. I thought the acting was great. It does seem more of a dark comedy because I found myself laugh at some parts. Is it far-fetched? Yeah ! Do people make some stupid choices, Yes.! As far as the flash drive it could've just been Destroyed or left at the church but, then there wouldn't be a story. I like the way the stories intertwined, it was pretty cool . I totally enjoyed this and I like these short limited series. Haven't seen anything good in a long time till now. Just watch it without reading these negative reviews and judge for yourself. Just don't get caught up with what would happen in "real life" . The final episode was awesome.

The premise is good: a criminalologist on death row (Tucci)who helps solves crimes (with apparent superpowers). The story is complete mess. Everyone acts illogically and against their own self interest. The plot ignores obvious alternatives to that behavior. You want to yell at the TV-'For god's sake don't do that!'. Tucci and Tenant are fine actors but wasted here. The only good thing about it is that it's short-Four episodes. I doubt it will be picked up for a second season. A shame since it could have been something good that could have continued for years. Sometimes the simpler way is better than a convict story.

We gave up in the first episode, when the idiot vicar left the pervert's memory stick lying around at home. Why did he do that? So that the writer could have him imprison the maths tutor in the cellar. How that tied in with Stanley Tucci on death row in the US I never found out and don't care.A couple of years ago the Beeb's annual report revealed that it had 106 executives and 76 creatives who "earn" more than the PM: well, their jobs are so much more onerous and significant, aren't they?No doubt one of those managers gave the green light to this disaster, whose many loopholes and idiocies have been detailed by others, and no doubt Steven Moffat is one of the 76. His bubble has burst and he's been rumbled. As for the BBC, it's been dumbing down for years and it's time the gravy train hit the buffers.

reviews.review_title: Clever, but ruined by treating the viewer as stupid.
reviews.content: Clever, but ruined by treating the viewer as stupid.This is in some ways a reasonable attempt at this absurd genre. A clever storyline, but ruined by, as another reviewer opines, "Two of my pet plot peeves are stupidity (the characters do something stupid to move the plot forward) and contrivance (circumstances beyond credibility to move the plot forward). So masterful in so many ways, it is a shame that this plot seems written by a drunk amateur shouting out random ideas."So, intelligent viewers will probably be frustrated or regret watching it; stupider people, if they like this sort of folly, might enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: Dark and Suspenseful? This is mind warping ghoulish!
reviews.content: From a technical and craft perspective, this is well done series. It has hidden riddles, good sets and scenes, and the plot moves logically. There is a tense wait for the two main characters to meet; and that reveal is well done. Tucci and Tennant are wonderful, and the remainder of the cast give wonderful performances.
